<<<<<<< HEAD
Iohn Hadlands advice: or a warning for all young men that have meanes advising them to forsake lewd company cards, dice, and queanes, to the tune of the bonny bonny broome. Crimsal, Richard.
1 sheet ([2] p.) : ill.
for Francis Coules, Printed at London : [ca. 1635]
Verse - "To all men now Ile plainely show,". Signed at end: R.C., i.e. Richard Crimsal. Publication date estimated by STC. In two parts; woodcuts at head of each part. Reproductions of the original in the British Library.
=======
Iohn Hadlands advice: or a warning for all young men that have meanes advising them to forsake lewd company cards, dice, and queanes, to the tune of the bonny bonny broome. Crimsal, Richard.
1 sheet ([2] p.) : ill.
for Francis Coules, Printed at London : [ca. 1635]
Verse - "To all men now Ile plainely show,". Signed at end: R.C., i.e. Richard Crimsal. Publication date estimated by STC. In two parts; woodcuts at head of each part. Reproductions of the original in the British Library.
Francis Coules
